text_result.title: Septoplasty MedlinePlus Medical Encyclopedia
text_result.fulltxt:
<ul>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> is surgery to correct any problems in the nasal septum the wall inside the nose that separates the nostrils See also Rhinoplasty Description     			 			 				 Return to top Most patients receive general anesthesia before septoplasty This wi<strong>  . . .</strong></li>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> home the same day Your surgeon will make a cut inside the wall on one side of your nose The mucus membrane that covers the wall will be lifted up Then your surgeon will remove or move any cartilage or bone that is causing the blockage in the area<strong>. . . </strong></li>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> To repair a crooked bent or deformed nasal septum that blocks the airway in your nose People with this condition usually breathe through their mouth and get infections on their nose Uncontrollable nosebleeds To repair a hole in the nasal septum<strong>. . . </strong></li>
 </ul>
